verbose_text: As the direction of the KCC2 transport is sensitive to small changes in the [Cl -] in and [K +] out near physiologic levels, the negative shifts of the E gly induced by bumetanide in heterozygous (+/cir) or homozygous (cir / cir) mice might result from the inhibition of KCC2 alone because bumetanide is known to partially block KCC2.
evidence: bumetanide is known to partially block KCC2
